Text: I walk through the early-morning capital.

Skel's run off somewhere, saying he's going to see
what info he can dig up.

(I said I was going to track down Rose, but I don't
actually intend to put much effort into it.)
(Wonder if she got away safely.)

(I would've loved to hear straight from her why she
did something as hardcore as stabbing her hubby-
to-be...)

I'm lost in thoughts like these when I hear the sound
of a piano playing.
Hm?
(They're pretty good.)

(Back in my old life, I learned piano as part of my
family's education plan.)

(Not gonna lie—I would've rather spent my time
training to be a shadowbroker than waste it on
something silly like that.)
(But then it started to grow on me.)

(Being good at piano made everyone around me assume I
was always busy practicing.)

(And for someone whose ambitions meant keeping his
social life to a minimum, this false impression was a
very welcome perk.)

(But most importantly, I simply realized how cool it
is to play piano.)

(I mean, isn't it? Playing piano allows me to show
off that I'm not all raw power, that I also have an
artistic side, too.)
(Badass...)
(Before I knew it, I got pretty serious about piano.)

(Shadowbroker prep work was always my top priority,
mind you.)

(But I just couldn't let go of the image of tickling
the ivory to set the mood before a big battle.)
(Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 14, "Moonlight," eh?)

(Even on a bright summer day, it can conjure up
images of the moon shining in the darkness.)

(It's one of my favorite songs. Actually, no, I
absolutely love it to the point that I don't think
there's any better theme for a shadowbroker.)
Wait, what's Moonlight Sonata doing in this world..?
(It's gotta be someone who reincarnated like me...)

The music comes from the ground floor cafe of one of
the swankiest luxury hotels in the city.

Security is tight enough that ordinary folks can't
get in, but I can since they know my face.

I waltz inside right as I hear the performance hit
its stride.

(The player has her slime bodysuit shaped into a
summery dress that carefully conceals the way it
pads out her chest and legs.)
(I'd expect no less of Epsilon the Faithful.)
(First Gamma, then Beta. Now her?)

I didn't know you were listening, my lord. I'm a
little embarrassed...
That was Moonlight Sonata just now, right?

Yes, it's my favorite out of all the songs you taught
me.
(I didn't intend to teach it to her...)

(But...I suppose I should be happy when someone tells
me they like the same things I do.)

My lord's wisdom has enabled me to forge connections
with influential figures as both a pianist and a composer.
Composer...?

Yes, of pieces such as "Moonlight Sonata,"  "The
Turkish March," and "The Minute Waltz"...

All of them have proven popular with the aristocracy,
and I've even won a royal award for musical excellence
here in the capital.
Oh, you did...

(Nothing more shameless than winning prizes for
plagiarized work.)

(Oh man... I offer my humblest apologies to all the
great maestros...)

I've also been invited to Oriana, Kingdom of the
Arts, as a promising composer.

As you are well aware, Oriana is currently a very
worthwhile place to "work."
Well, they do love the arts there.

Indeed... And I think my "work" this time will be
especially fruitful.
Well, good luck.

I will deliver my best "work" and performances so as
not to bring shame upon the incomparable melodies
you have blessed me with, my lord.
Okay, go knock 'em out.
Oh, that's right.

Do you know the whereabouts of Princess Rose of
Oriana?

Princess Rose... I believe Beta is in charge of that
case.

The only details I have heard...is that she fled into
the tunnels beneath the city.
Underground, huh?
I shall send a messenger to Beta at once.
No, that's okay.
That's all the info I need.

(If I'm lucky enough to find Rose, I can at least
hear her out.)
You look as dazzling as ever today, Epsilon.
N-N-Not at all...!
I still have much room to improve...
(My criticism of her stealing others' work aside...)
I suddenly stop as I notice the cafe's grand piano.

It gleams mysteriously in the sunlight pouring
through the bright windows.
Heh...
I gaze at it for a moment, then grin.
